Adding Work Records to a Task

After working on a task or subtask, you should add a work record to indicate what was done and the time spent. For example, if you work on a task for one hour on Day 1 and for three hours on Day 2, you would enter two work records, one for each day.

After you have added a work record to a task, you cannot create subtasks for it.

To add work records to a task or subtask:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click the Task tab on the upper pane.

  3. Do one of the following:

    • Double-click a task or subtask to display the Task properties dialog. Select the Work tab and click Add.

    • Select a task or subtask, then highlight Task > Add Work from the menu.

    The Work Record dialog opens. It displays your name in the User Name drop-down list box.

  4. Enter or select the date for the work record from the drop-down calendar.

  5. Enter the number of hours worked in the Work text box.

  6. Enter the number of hours it will take to complete the task in the Remaining Work text box.

  7. If desired, enter a comment about the progress that has been made in the Comments text box.

  8. Click OK to confirm the work record.

Note: You can also add a comment about a task on the Notes tab of the Task properties dialog.
